meanings.definition: To purchase goods or services at a price lower than the market value.
meanings.sent1: I always try to underbuy items on sale to save money.
meanings.sent2: She decided to underbuy the shoes because they were too expensive.
meanings.sent3: My friend tried to underbuy the concert tickets, but they ended up being fake!
meanings.sent4: He tends to underbuy groceries, which leads to multiple trips to the store.
meanings.sent5: The company had to underbuy raw materials to cut costs, but it affected production.

meanings.definition: To buy less than is needed or desired.
meanings.sent1: When I underbuy groceries, I always run out of food before the week ends.
meanings.sent2: She tends to underbuy clothes and then regrets not having enough options.
meanings.sent3: I accidentally underbought party supplies, so we had to make do with what we had.
meanings.sent4: Underbuying presents for the holidays can lead to disappointment for loved ones.
meanings.sent5: It's better to underbuy paint than to have too much leftover after the project.
